duties_responsibilities.duty: Project Lead – Responsible for the daily functions of one or more handscoring contracts, coordinating with program and project managers to ensure project readiness, managing a team of Scoring Directors, Supervisors, and Scorers, and performing post-project work and data analysis.

Content Expertise – Thorough knowledge of science topics used for Elementary, Middle, and High School Science, and an ability to understand and apply state and national science standards, developing item-specific training, and providing expertise in meetings with clients and educators.

Logistics and Communication – Clear communication to a variety of roles daily is required, including communication via chat, email, phone, posted reports, and videoconference meetings. In-person and virtual interactions with the customer and other educators are expected.

Training and Coaching – Mentoring and training Scoring Directors, Supervisors, and Scorers in the expectations of their roles, as well as live training or pre-recorded module Science and potentially Math items to a large and varied scorer population.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree required; degree within Life Science or Physical Sciences is strongly preferred. Additional Math college courses are preferred. Two (2) years assessment industry experience as a Scoring Director or other scoring team lead or equivalent experience.
